results.question: What led to lower capital expenditures at Bell Media in 2019?
gold_answer: production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
results.markdown_table_response: As Bell Media is a large communications company, capital spending is higher compared to other large companies due to the need to maintain and enhance its network infrastructure.
results.csv_string_response:
BCE’s capital expenditure rate declined in 2019 due to the following factors:
• The increase in revenue in 2019 due to an increase in subscriber numbers and a further expansion in the LTE-A network
• Lower capital expenditures in the wireline segment of $10 million due to the continued deployment of FTTP, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts
• Lower capital expenditures in the wireless segment of $33 million due to the advancement of LTE-A network build-out
• Lower capital expenditures at Bell Media of $6 million due to the production equipment and IT upgrades in 2018
results.json_rows_response: In 2019, Bell Media spent $6 million on capital expenditures compared to $10 million in 2018. This reflected the execution of business customer contracts, the roll-out of fixed WTTP to more homes and businesses, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts. The execution of business customer contracts and the roll-out of fixed WTTP to more homes and businesses led to lower capital expenditures. The reduced capital expenditures in 2019 were also due to a modest reduction in capital expenditures in the wireline segment in 2018, as we continued to focus our investments on the ongoing deployment of FTTP to more homes and businesses, the connection of fibre Internet and TV services to more homes and businesses and the execution of business customer contracts.
